answers.answer: Are you eating plenty of veggies (complex carbs) and lean protein?Yes, I'm sure 1200 calories is way too little for you and that could be part of your problem.  If you don't eat enough calories, your body holds onto fat, rather than letting it go.  If your exercise consists of walking back and forth, your body may simply be used to that much movement and that's what it expects every day; it's no challenge.Have you had your thyroid levels tested to make sure you don't have hypothyroidism?  Hypothyroidism often goes hand in hand with PCOS and many people with fibromyalgia find that the pain goes away once they get on a thyroid replacement hormone.  Ask your doctor to test TSH, Free T3 and Free T4.

Its normal.. you started really high, so it waasy to lose pounds, but as you get closer to target weight, i'll be harder. Try to cut as much as possible process foods.(canned, boxed, dried etc) and do eat more calories. We need calories,it's what gives our bodies energy. But your on your way! Carbs a the worst thing you could take when you have diabetes( transforms into sugar) congrats and strenght be with you on this journey!!

question: Hi . I started my weight loss journey Jan 2012 at 338 plus the scale wouldn't weigh me .. I've gotten to 273 and I am stuck. I tried lowering calories I believe I lowered to much to 1200. I have a active job Im on the go all day walking back and forth .I can't do much rigorous exercise due to fibromyalgia. I also have pcos making weightless very hard I am on a diabetic medication that is used off label for this.. I limit carbs ,no soda I don't see what I'm doing wrong .. Thanks y'all so much
title: plato
